Your guide points into the distance where a pod of dolphins jump into the air. The bottlenose dolphin can live in a group of 20 members on average and has a playful manner. They jump into the waves and arch out of the water before splashing back down. They can grow up to 13 feet long and weigh more than 600 pounds. You can hear the kids gasp in awe, hoping the dolphins come closer.

dayInfo.title: Gold Coast – Watching the Surf
dayInfo.description: In the morning, surfers head to the water to catch the waves as the sun rises over the horizon. The cool morning air carries the scent of the ocean through the city streets. Cafes open their doors to the aroma of freshly baked pastries and roasted coffee beans. At breakfast, the family watches as the surfers glide beneath curls and fling themselves through the air as waves fade out. In the Currumbin Wildlife Sanctuary, rainbow lorikeets twitter to one another. Their rainbow-colored plumage stands out against the emerald leaves of the surrounding trees. The adventures of Australia have offered the family fun times exploring wildlife and sea life, rainforest and coral reefs, red sand desert and white sand beaches for an unforgettable experience bringing the family closer together. Your private transfer meets you at the hotel and escorts you to the Gold Coast airport for your flight home.

tourName: Farm to Table Luxury Culinary Tour of Australia
placesVisited: Coles Bay, Hobart, Barossa Valley, Flinders Range, Launceston, Kangaroo Island, Sydney
generalInfo: Live in the lap of Australian farm-to-table luxury for 20 days on this exclusive tailored tour from Tasmania to New South Wales. Treat yourself to top-tier accommodation and exceptional experiences as you witness the mesmerizing wilderness and sip on a selection of prestigious wines during this lavish handpicked wildlife and wine excursion in the country’s coveted destinations. Leave no adventure unmissed as you explore Australia’s culture, cuisine, and scenery.

dayInfo.title: Launceston - Awe-Inspiring Architecture of the City
dayInfo.description: The Tasmanian riverside city of Launceston is an architectural masterpiece composed of Art Deco, Colonial, and Victorian buildings spreading across a cityscape peppered with luxuriant parks. You will touch down at the airport and meet your private transfer, who will escort you to a stunning accommodation nestled in the heart of the city. From here, you may admire the century-old charm of the Georgian sandstone architecture and enjoy light strolls through the exuberant districts in search of delectable Australian cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Launceston - Rewarding Trek up Ben Lomond
dayInfo.description: Led by an expert ecologist, you will spend the day foraging through the unspoiled forests sweeping northern Tasmania after breakfast. You will climb the highest point of Ben Lomond Mountain and be rewarded with alluring views of the sprawling viridian surrounds. Along the way, you will encounter endemic creatures such as Quolls, Pademelons, and Tasmanian Devils ruffling within the shrubbery as your guide recounts fables of the Tasmanian Tigers. Arriving at a bushfire campsite, you will indulge in a collection of exquisite canapes as the scenes come to life with dancing animals and flowers waving in the fields.

dayInfo.title: Launceston - Indulgent Tastes of Tamar
dayInfo.description: Tasmania’s wilderness is home to many fascinating creatures but the spectacular landscape also boasts bountiful harvests of fruit and vegetables. In particular, the Tamar region is famed for its abundance of rich vineyards that cascade the rolling hills enwreathing its expanse. Today, you will head to the acclaimed wine region to dabble in the fruits of elite estate’s labor, accompanied by sommeliers who will elaborate on the distinct vintages and each winery's distinguished production process. All will be set within one of Tasmania’s gorgeous hilly scenes and soundtracked by the gentle whistle of the wind and singing birds.

dayInfo.title: Coles Bay - Luxury Living by the Sea
dayInfo.description: On the fourth morning of your vacation, your travels will lead you through the flourishing emerald farmlands, along the Freycinet Mountain Range, and down to the wrapping golden coastline of Coles Bay. You will soon arrive at a stunning luxury resort hemmed into the forested hills flanking the bay, and check into your palatial suite overlooking the turquoise sea from a stylish and secluded terrace. You may spend this afternoon wallowing in the quietude of this hideaway destination, refreshing the mind and body as you treat yourself to an aromatic spa therapy.

dayInfo.title: Coles Bay - Steeped Heritage and Stunning Scenes of Schouten Island
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will zip down to the soft shoreline and climb aboard a private yacht setting sail across the crystal clear waters. Your voyage will take you to Schouten Island, where you will catch glimpses of the soaring birdlife, swimming marine mammals, and colorful sea life dancing around the temperate reefs that lie below the sapphire sea. Along the breathtaking Freycinet Peninsula, you will take in the history and culture of Tasmanian Aborigines, particularly the Oyster Bay tribe, who once inhabited this magical island.

dayInfo.title: Coles Bay - Magic Marine Moments and Protecting the Tasmanian Devil
dayInfo.description: Today, you will visit a world-famous oyster farm and slip on a pair of waders to try your hand at gathering the beloved local Pacific oysters. With your knees still submerged in the tranquil estuary, you will slurp down the sumptuous delicacy as your guide imparts insight on the surrounding wetlands and the marine ecology all beneath remarkable panoramas of the Hazards. This afternoon, you will visit the Tasmanian Devil Breeding Center, where you will have the unique opportunity to interact with the endangered animals and partake in the pursuit of protecting them.

dayInfo.title: Hobart - Scenic Cruise to the Harbor
dayInfo.description: The sun will rise over Coles Bay and dance off the glossy water, creating a splendid scene to sip on fresh coffee as your morning breezes slowly on by. Shortly after breakfast, you will self drive along the Eastern Coast for an opportunity to take in all the stunning scenery that unfolds around each bend in the road. Your journey will bring you to the historic Hobart harbor, a charming destination boasting antique architectural buildings representing the former settlers of this landscape. While relishing in the buzzing atmosphere, your acclaimed chef will whip up an assortment of mouth-watering dishes.

dayInfo.title: Hobart - Across the Azure Sea of the Eastern Coastline
dayInfo.description: There are few better ways to appreciate the idyllic seascapes of Hobart than by boat, and today you will board a private cruise setting sail across the azure waters and along the picturesque coastline. Dramatic jagged cliffs, dense emerald forests, and colorful marine creatures will greet you as you peacefully glide across the glassy sea with your eyes eagerly peeled for the next intriguing sighting. Before turning in back at the harbor, you will spend the afternoon basking in the golden sunshine and tanning on the pearly beaches hugging the eastern coastline.

dayInfo.title: Hobart - Magnificent Wines of MONA
dayInfo.description: Today, you will return to the harbor’s edge only this time to board a private seaplane for a marvelous adventure to MONA. Hovering over Hobart, you will have unbridled panoramas of the breathtaking destination, the flowing Derwent River, and the towering peaks of Mount Wellington. Arriving at MONA, you will head straight for the Wine Bar to sip on a selection of prestigious vintages prepared in the famous wine region. You will cool off as you taste the nuanced flavors of each bottle as well as tuck into an assortment of sumptuous snacks.

dayInfo.title: Barossa Valley - Curate Your Own Blend of Wine
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will fly to Adelaide via Melbourne and enjoy a brief but beautiful scenic drive through the countryside to the renowned Barossa Valley. Coveted as one of the country’s elite wine regions, you will relish these two nights spent spoiling yourselves with taste tours of exemplary vintages and evenings spent in a palatial suite. Upon arrival, wine and food lovers may design and craft a personal chef’s knife alongside a professional forger or create a distinct signature blend of wine to commemorate this elegant leg of your vacation.

dayInfo.title: Barossa Valley - All About Australian Wine
dayInfo.description: Today, you will tour the viridian landscapes of the Barossa Valley chaperoned by the best sommeliers in this part of Australia, visiting the elite estates speckling the bucolic region. Your journeys will lead you to wineries known for their exceptional vintages, with some boasting the oldest Shiraz vineyards in the world and others having a tremendous influence over wine-making in Australia as a whole. With each stop, you will have the opportunity to indulge in the coveted wines as you soak up the scenic splendors before returning to your resort in the evening.

dayInfo.title: Flinders Range - Fabulous Wildlife Finds in Flinders
dayInfo.description: You will revel in a four-hour scenic drive to the illustrious geological landscape of Flinders Range this morning, glancing over the unspoiled and untouched surroundings that sit between you and your destination. After checking into your gorgeous accommodation, you will set off on a bushwalk of the region leading from Flinders through the creek beds and peaceful waterholes to the Cyprus-carpeted hills that cover the landscape. Your knowledgeable guide will share stories about the settlers of this idyllic region as you snap up images of your mesmerizing surroundings.

dayInfo.title: Flinders Range - Wondrous Walking to Witness the Wildlife
dayInfo.description: Today, you will wake to the sounds of the birds singing from the trees and feel the brisk breeze rolling through the canopy against your cheeks. After enjoying a delightful breakfast, you will venture further through Flinders, stopping at viewpoints atop craggy cliffs and foraging through emerald forests that blanket the enchanting landscape. Along the way, you will capture images of the creatures dwelling in this dense vegetation and catch wafts of the fragrant flowers blossoming alongside the trails.

dayInfo.title: Flinders Range - Magic Moments beneath the Stars
dayInfo.description: Flinders is a massive destination brimming with wilderness finds and you will spend your final day here enjoying your last opportunity to see what more you can discover. Set off along the shaded paths with an experienced ranger to locate rare wildlife species and iconic plants growing in the thicket. After your extensive discovery of the illustrious wilderness, you will head back to camp where you will be treated to a gourmet dinner prepared under the stars. You will cherish the moments savoring these delectable flavors while shooting stars zip through the midnight sky.

dayInfo.title: Kangaroo Island - The Beauty of Australia's Galapagos
dayInfo.description: From one remarkable wildlife destination to another, you will transfer to the stunning Kangaroo Island shortly after breakfast today. You will find comfort in a tranquil retreat tucked away in what many refer to as Australia’s Galapagos, flanked by a vast expanse of untouched environment teeming with marvelous mammals, beautiful birdlife, and fragrant flora. This afternoon, you will revitalize the mind and body as you luxuriate to your resort’s top-tier amenities and soak up your atmospheric surroundings before indulging in a decadent dinner under the stars.

dayInfo.title: Kangaroo Island - Discover What Lies Within the Green
dayInfo.description: Over the next two days on Kangaroo Island, you will discover the majestic scenes under the guidance of an experienced ranger who will show you to iconic sightseeing spots between the forests and along the coastline. During these tours, you will stumble upon seals wading in the temperate waters, koalas hugging the towering branches, and echidnas scuttling through the shrubbery to name a few. Furthermore, dramatic landscapes composed of craggy limestone cliffs and stretches of sugary sand will backdrop your wilderness adventures.

dayInfo.title: Kangaroo Island - The Furry and Floral Residents
dayInfo.description: Today, you will see more of Kangaroo Island as you join your knowledgeable guide once more for an adventurous day out in the unspoiled landscape. The entire journey will prove unforgettable, sharing incredible moments worth capturing as you spot endemic creatures native to the island and marvel over the marine wonders swimming in the sparkling waters. There will not be a moment to miss as you slowly make your way through the island’s illustrious habitats in search of the furry and floral residents.

dayInfo.title: Sydney - Scenes of the Sydney Opera House
dayInfo.description: You will spend the final leg of your vacation in Australia’s sparkling capital of New South Wales, Sydney. Transferring after breakfast, you will soon catch a glimpse of the iconic Sydney Opera House nestled on the border of the Sydney Harbour, an image waxed lyrical in recent memory. Arriving in Sydney, you will be whisked away to your stellar accommodation boasting unrivaled vistas of the harbor and the glittery water that flanks the dazzling cityscape. Spend your evening admiring the sights, sounds, and smells of the bustling cosmopolitan at an exquisite Michelin-starred restaurant.

dayInfo.title: Sydney - Immerse Yourself in the Magic of Sydney
dayInfo.description: Your second day in Sydney is dedicated to exploring its history and culture, beginning with a behind-the-scenes tour of the iconic Sydney Opera House. You will appreciate fine art, meet remarkable curators, peruse the spirited markets of Paddington before savoring lunch at a beloved butchery serving an assortment of sumptuous cuts. To round off a day of exploration, you will experience the Twilights Bridge Climb, ascending ladders and strolling along catwalks that afford breathtaking vistas of Sydney’s twinkling skyline from towering summits.

dayInfo.title: Sydney - The Brilliance of New South Wales
dayInfo.description: It will be your final day in Australia and your last opportunity to enjoy the many wonders of Sydney before you transfer to the international airport and catch your plane headed home. Whether you wish to enjoy a light bite at one of the many glamorous cafes or stroll through the light-flooded streets to museums and heritage sites flecking the skyline, spend these moments leisurely and pleasurably basking in the brilliance of the New South Wales capital. You will soon say your goodbyes to Australia, leaving with many fabulous memories of your trip.

tourName: Flourishing Australia Tour: Coastal Reverie, Thriving Cities, and Amazing Wildlife
placesVisited: Sydney, Mary River Floodplains, Port Douglas, Daintree Rainforest, Melbourne
generalInfo: Australia comes to life during this 15-day tour of Sydney, the Mary River Floodplains, the Daintree Rainforest, and the scenic city of Melbourne. Largely dominated by immaculate coastlines and the legendary bush, your visit will blend both the thrills of city life and the mystical charm of the world's oldest rainforest. Fall in love with each destination and the unique experiences available. By the time your journey concludes, it will be no surprise why Australia is a top tourist destination of the world.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – In the Thriving Metropolis
dayInfo.description: The friendly embrace of Sydney will be yours to enjoy on the inaugural afternoon of this 15-day adventure through Australia. As the capital of New South Wales, Sydney occupies two worlds: one where a sleek transit system and municipal facilities speak to the city's modernity and another where bandicoots and bats invade the city from the neighboring bush. After you get settled in to your comfortable accommodation, you will be able to celebrate your first day on a 40-foot yacht voyage around the harbor. During this adventure, your skipper will regale you with tales of this previous penal colony.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – Walking Tour of the City
dayInfo.description: As a jewel of development set against the allure of the Australian bush, Sydney allows visitors to enjoy a vast collection of activities and adventures around every corner. Today, you will stick to land and embark on a customizable day tour of the city that will reveal all of the off-the-beaten-paths sights and experiences. On this tour, the hospitable nature of Sydney will come to life. Your tour also includes an immersion into the vibrant cafe culture, an exploration of Australian aboriginal peoples, and a visit to one of Sydney's many sandy beaches.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – Eat Your Way Across the City
dayInfo.description: Contemporary cuisine will be yours to enjoy as you eat and drink your way across Sydney. Since the emergence of domestic and international travel, the food and beverage scene in the city has enjoyed an eruption in popularity. Today, there are numerous eateries for you to satisfy your appetite and enjoy some of the local grub. A knowledgeable guide will be your ambassador to this world where you can learn the ropes of coffee roasting and try your hand at making butter if you are feeling confident. By the end of the day, you will be left to enjoy your evening at leisure, feeling entirely satisfied with the day's adventures.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – Bird's Eye View of the City
dayInfo.description: By your final day in Sydney, you will feel as if it is a home away from home because the friendly locals and energetic nightlife lend the city such a youthful ambiance. What the Colosseum is to Rome, the Opera House is to Sydney. Today, you will enjoy a tour of this famous and iconic structure. Afterward, the trendy neighborhood of Paddington will be yours to visit and learn why Sydney is quickly becoming one of the most expensive urban areas in the world. In the evening, you will enjoy a special trip up the famous Sydney Harbour Bridge to enjoy some spectacular views.

dayInfo.title: Bamurru Plains – The Mary River Floodplains
dayInfo.description: One of Australia's biggest attractions is the abundance of endemic wildlife that can be found here. The biodiversity here has long attracted visitors. It should be no surprise that your journey will take you through the city of Darwin. After departing Sydney, you will cross the continent to reach Australia's Northern edge and the territorial capital that was named after the famous naturalist. From there, you will venture by private car to enter the stunning floodplain of the Mary River. After arriving, the remainder of the day will be yours to soak up the ambient beauty.

dayInfo.title: Mary River Floodplains – An Animal Paradise
dayInfo.description: Perhaps, it will be the distant cry of a wild dingo or the savannah sun that greets you on your first morning in this stunning Australian retreat. The wetlands of this floodplain and the ecosystems it sustains help act as an air filter by removing carbon dioxide from the atmosphere. The flora and fauna here are also unlike anywhere else. Wallabies, wild pig, buffalo, and crocodiles all play their part in the ecosystem, and you can choose from a menu of activities in which to engage with this vibrant wilderness.

dayInfo.title: Mary River Floodplains – A Swampy Setting
dayInfo.description: Your accommodation at the floodplains offers daily game drives into the bush. During these drives, your professional guide will help introduce you to this stunning environment. Similar to preserves in swampy states, airboat tours are an option as well. The airboat tours offer an exciting way to spy on the flock of migratory birds that nest here or the crocodiles that call the swamp home. In the afternoon, you will be able to relax with a good book and enjoy some time at your leisure before your final evening.

dayInfo.title: Port Douglas – Coastal Reverie
dayInfo.description: Today will largely be a travel day, but the journey will be well worth it because your final destination will be the Great Barrier Reef. Emerging from the bush with more than enough stories to tell, you will make your way back to Darwin by private car before heading to the state of Queensland and your destination of Port Douglas. With a small permanent population, Port Douglas swells during the tourism season as visitors come for the sandy beaches and nearby UNESCO World Heritage Sites. After arriving in this charming community, the remainder of the day will be yours to explore at your own pace.

dayInfo.title: Port Douglas – Catamaran Cruise
dayInfo.description: Port Douglas is the perfect launch point for nearby adventures. Today will be no exception as you take to the seas with a thrilling visit to the coral reef on a majestic sailing catamaran. Leisure will be the principal theme today as you enjoy the mesmeric views, refreshing water, and marine environment that is full of life. After you worked up an appetite, a seafood lunch will be served before you journey to the Low Isles and the lighthouse.

dayInfo.title: Daintree Rainforest – A UNESCO World Heritage Site
dayInfo.description: After enjoying a leisurely morning, you will make your way into Daintree National Park and Australia's oldest rainforest. The lodge where you will be staying will offer a great launchpad for excursions along the Mossman River or into the gorge of the same name. Like the river plain you visited earlier, here you will find an abundance of natural wildlife and complimentary ecosystems that each demonstrate the benefits of symbiosis. Upon your arrival, the remainder of the day will be yours to enjoy.

dayInfo.title: Daintree Rainforest – Ziplining Adventure
dayInfo.description: Green and blue will be the principal colors on today's palette of exciting adventures in the Daintree National Rainforest. You will embark early in the morning and venture into the lush canopy of the jungle. Here, you will fly through one of the most ecologically diverse areas on the planet by way of a zipline. After a tasty lunch of local fare, you will be met by a guide who will walk you through the vibrant culture of the local Kuku Yalanji people. These people lived off the plentiful produce of the sea and forest. By the time you return to the lodge, the devoted hospitality of the staff will be a welcoming relief after the day's excitement.

dayInfo.title: Melbourne – Australia's Second-Largest City
dayInfo.description: After one final breakfast from your lodge staff, you will return to the town of Cairns for a short flight into Victoria to the capital city of Melbourne. As the second-largest city in Australia, Melbourne boasts a head-spinning array of attractions that date back to its founding in 1835. The city also offers contemporary visitors some excellent shopping and sightseeing opportunities. After your arrival at the airport, a private transfer will whisk you effortlessly through the traffic and to your luxurious hotel.

dayInfo.title: Melbourne – The Capital of Victoria
dayInfo.description: The contemporary architecture on display in Melbourne is some of the best in Australia. Into the colorful capital city you will step on a private walking tour today. As you ponder the UNESCO approved Royal Exhibition Building and bask in the lively street music and art scene, the exuberant side of Victoria will be revealed. Your guide will ensure that no curiosity goes unexplained during your tour, including the local fascination with Vegemite.

dayInfo.title: Melbourne – Snacking through the City
dayInfo.description: Your final day on this journey will be spent recharging your batteries on a private foodie Tour. Melbourne's thriving market scene is a sight to behold, and colorful stalls present vendors and their wares to potential buyers. Here, the perennial art of haggling is skillfully practiced. As you amble along, refreshment will come in the form of local beer and bites from local shops and eateries. By the time this customizable tour concludes, you will have a whole new appreciation for Australian cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Melbourne – Departure
dayInfo.description: Today, you can rise early and enjoy one last stroll along Melbourne's scenic waterfront before departing. From swampy floodplains and dense jungle to seaside cruises and an immersive walking tour, the precarious blend of bush and bustling city has been well on display. Like the proverbial tip of the iceberg, you will end this tour with plenty of curiosity to plan your next adventure into the outback.

tourName: Highlights of Australia Itinerary for Seniors
placesVisited: Melbourne, Uluru, Alice Springs, Cairns, Kuranda, Port Douglas, Great Barrier Reef, Sydney, Blue Mountains
generalInfo: Culture, wildlife, and wilderness immerse you in splendor during your 14-day Australia highlights tour for seniors. Koalas will cling to eucalyptus trees and kangaroos will bounce past your view. The Red Centre will glow at sunrise while the alleys of Melbourne brim with lively cafes. Your customizable tour will travel at your preferred pace as you discover the diverse and unparalleled highlights of Australia.

dayInfo.title: Melbourne - A Cultural Welcome Along the Beach
dayInfo.description: It is impossible not to feel a little jet-lagged when flying into Australia. For most travelers, this giant cut-off island is as far as you can fly. Melbourne is a relaxed and easy-going city for getting over the switch in time zones. There is life at all hours of the day, from people strolling the beach at sunrise to enclaves of shops and restaurants staying open into the night. Scattered over a vast area, Melbourne is Australia’s most artistic and cultural city, with treasures to find in dozens of contrasting neighborhoods. Most visitors quickly feel at home and dive right into exploring it all. This is also a city with many miles of open beaches, so there is something to suit every mood. On your airport transfer, you will be taken to the southern suburbs, and your hotel will look out over the ocean waves with a long promenade for space to stretch your legs after the flight.

dayInfo.title: Melbourne - Settling Into the Australian Experience
dayInfo.description: A half-day city tour is planned today, with the timing flexible as you wake up and adjust to the time zone. Take the tram into central Melbourne, and a juxtaposition of style unfolds with narrow and squat colonial leftovers meeting with gleaming futuristic buildings. Grand old marketplaces are stuffed with multicultural stalls, and you will continually switch from the late 19thcentury to tomorrow’s world. The Royal Arcade and Flinders Street Station are essential sights, along with Queen Victoria Market. But mostly the experience is the contrasts as the old and the new mingle seamlessly along each street. Most of the tour is done by tram, a leisurely means of getting around and getting a sense of the city. Just hop off to important sights and settle into the Australian way of doing things.

dayInfo.title: Melbourne - Seeing Kangaroos and Koalas in the Wild
dayInfo.description: On open plains the kangaroo sit and wait. There can be over a dozen of them, and you will approach slowly, a few steps forward before waiting for any reaction. Springing happily, they move with great hopping movements across green pastures. These are wild kangaroos, such iconicity to their frames, and such intimacy to the experience. While these marsupials move, those nearby are still, clinging to eucalyptus branches with a sleepy look in their eye. Koalas. Not bears as some may think, just koalas in a drowsy state, so quiet and still you can come to within just a few meters. Stand beneath these trees, and you will have a prime view onto a wild species that has become increasingly vulnerable and endangered. You will not touch or interact with these animals today as it will be an authentic wild experience in a nature reserve one hour from the city.

dayInfo.title: Uluru - The Great Monolith and the Desert Stars
dayInfo.description: Now the adventure really begins as you fly westward to three days in Australia’s red center. Uluru glows red from the plane window, and it is enormous beyond boundaries and changing color on a whim, so it is easy to see why Uluru so hypnotized for many thousands of years. Tour the base to see Aboriginal paintings, and then sip on sundowners as Uluru goes through its most dramatic daily color change. After dusk the southern sky unfolds, an astronomer your guide to a Milky Way of sparkles and shimmers. Uluru is one of the world’s most isolated travel destinations and almost every night is clear, bringing a wonderful experience each time the sun goes down.

dayInfo.title: Uluru to Kings Canyon - Exploring Kata Tjuta and Bush Camping
dayInfo.description: Sunrise and you will be at the other monoliths, the domes of Kata Tjuta. They rise from shadow and glow effortlessly, enticing you forward. This site is incredibly important to local Aboriginal people, with just a small section accessible by visitors. You can choose from two hikes of differing length, or you can opt for an easy walk. After breakfast, you will continue with your desert adventure as you bump across the red rock to Kings Canyon, another surreal feat of nature in the middle of nowhere. Tonight you will stay inside this strange place for a luxurious outback glamping experience that will bring a deep connection with the outback. Your tent is more like a contemporary hotel room, with a private bathroom and running hot water. Yet the canvas walls and simple exterior mean you can stay within the landscape, rather than on the edge.

dayInfo.title: Kings Canyon to Alice Springs - Continuing the Wild Desert Adventure
dayInfo.description: Over time, the wind has shaped incredible boulders, and many of them remain perched precariously in Devils Marbles Conservation Reserve. Deep inside the red canyon, you can hear water bubbling, and on the remote Kings Creek Walk you will see signs of life with small birds and messages inscribed in stone. From Uluru to Alice Springs is around eight hours of driving, and this will be the second day of a private four-wheel drive adventure that leads you across the desert to the most remote outpost town of them all. Not much happens in Alice Springs, yet it is an interesting little town that feels like a frontier and builds a broader picture of life in Australia, both now and back in history. You will spend the night in the town’s best hotel, and leave refreshed and relaxed.

dayInfo.title: Cairns to Port Douglas - Between the Rainforest and the Ocean
dayInfo.description: From Alice Springs you will fly back east, touching down on the Pacific coast at Cairns. From here, it will be a one-hour transfer north that skirts both rainforest and ocean. Port Douglas is a dreamy place for Australian retirees, a slow-moving town with beautiful beaches and beautiful year-round weather, backdropped by rainforest and studded with small cafes and restaurants. Every visitor immediately feels at home here, and you will notice a big change from the desert. Nothing is planned for the day so that you can check out Port Douglas at your leisure, perhaps with some time on the beach.

dayInfo.title: Port Douglas - Aboriginal Dreaming Day Tour
dayInfo.description: Many people think of Australia’s Aboriginal people as desert dwellers, yet hundreds of individual tribes once thrived here, each with their own land and specialism. This morning you will be guided by an Aboriginal from the rainforest and learn the use of each plant. Then this afternoon, you will be guided by a coastal tribe, on a “hunter-gatherer” walk across open sands. In between these experiences you will be with an artist and learn the meanings behind many Aboriginal paintings, and then create your own cryptic message. This is a tour that will quickly dispel stereotypes about Aboriginal people and add to your understanding of the complexity of their past and future.

dayInfo.title: Port Douglas - Discovering the Great Barrier Reef
dayInfo.description: Colors tumble through the water, luminous despite the ocean depth. Small fish whizz around a giant grouper as eels poke their heads from slabs of rock. The Great Barrier Reef is as its name suggests, a barrier constructed by thousands of individual reefs. On your boat tour, you will cruise to a pontoon perched above a reef. Once at the pontoon, you can choose how you want to explore. Snorkeling and diving are possibilities, as well as a helicopter above it all. There is also the option of a semi-submersible craft which is ideal for many senior travelers as you can explore the different reefs and a magical underwater world, without getting wet or being pulled by ocean currents.

dayInfo.title: Cairns to Sydney - Cruising the Parramatta River
dayInfo.description: Fly south and check into your five-star hotel on Darling Harbour, just two stops by Metro to the Opera House and with dozens of good restaurants in very close walking distance. The famous city is compact and easy to get around, especially the old center. Spend some time getting to know the city’s atmosphere before a sunset Parramatta cruise offers a more complete introduction. Beneath the Harbour Bridge you will go, past the Opera House sails before setting course towards the ocean. Returning towards Circular Quay in time for the sunset, you can watch city lights come on as dinner is served and enjoy the beauty of the city.

dayInfo.title: Sydney - Sydney City Tour and the Famous Opera House
dayInfo.description: It is in The Rocks where Sydney has an early colonial history, inside an enclave of squat stone buildings and cobbled streets. There are Aboriginal tales nearby, and then stories of Queen Victoria told through grandiose arcades. While Melbourne was spread out, the middle of Sydney is compact, with all of the key sights packed together for a very manageable tour for senior travelers. This evening you will visit the most iconic place of them all, the Sydney Opera House. You will take in a performance and discover what takes place behind the iconic sails.

dayInfo.title: Sydney - A Day in the Blue Mountains
dayInfo.description: The haze is blue just an hour outside Sydney, and it hangs low above a eucalyptus forest, with stark orange peaks poking above. Welcome to the Blue Mountains, a surreal and often silent landscape unlike what you would imagine of Australia. Each of the peaks has an Aboriginal name and story as trails weave through the eucalyptus forest below. The world’s steepest train track takes you between mountain and valley floor, and later your guide will drive you to a succession of viewpoints, providing an insight into Australian bush land. Why is the haze blue? How did this landscape come to be? These are questions that can only be answered once you see the Blue Mountains in person, for photos cannot reflect the surreal splendor of this place. It will be a full-day small-group tour from Sydney, stopping at an animal conservation area as you return to the city.

dayInfo.title: Sydney - Relaxing on Legendary Beaches
dayInfo.description: Your final day will be left free, and Sydney’s eastern beaches are a good choice for a self-guided day trip. Using the city’s excellent transport systems you can easily reach Bondi, the most famous beach of all. From here, there are coastal walkways up and down the coastal cliffs that lead you to different bays and beaches. An alternative is to take the ferry to Manly, a longer beach with a far flatter promenade to walk upon. Of course, you may choose to ignore the beach, Sydney also being a place of excellent museums and shopping arcades.

dayInfo.title: Sydney - Departure
dayInfo.description: After breakfast you are transferred to Sydney’s international airport for your outbound flight.

tourName: Highlights of the Australian Outback: Kangaroo Safari
placesVisited: Melbourne, Warrnambool, Grampians National Park, Kangaroo Island, Flinders Ranges, Perth, Margaret River
generalInfo: Featuring incredible landscapes and immersive encounters with kangaroos, this 13-day safari leads you into wonderfully diverse bush and outback. Immerse yourself in the marsupial realm on the ultimate Australia kangaroo safari. From the Great Ocean Road to the Grampians and from Melbourne to the Margaret River, prepare yourself for an impressive array of giants.

dayInfo.title: Melbourne – Cultural Experiences
dayInfo.description: You will touch down in Melbourne to encounter a city on the move. Victorian architecture is squashed between glass-fronted skyscrapers, and old arcades contrast with shimmering restaurants and contemporary architecture. This is a changing city that will offer you an immediate impression of Australia’s old and new. Your private driver will greet you at the airport and transfer you to your luxury accommodation on the river. The rest of the day will be at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Melbourne – Wild Kangaroos and Koalas
dayInfo.description: Australia’s wildlife is as the name entails: wild. You do not need to visit a wildlife sanctuary to come face-to-face with kangaroos, wallabies, koalas, and others. To begin your kangaroo safari, you will have a half-day trip to a small nature reserve south of Melbourne. Trackers will travel ahead of you and radio in koala locations so that you can easily see their sleepy eyes and eucalyptus-clinging antics. Large kangaroo mobs will be the main highlight here. Hopping and grazing on open plains, they make for thrilling first encounters, especially when large males start to box.

dayInfo.title: Warrnambool – The Great Ocean Road
dayInfo.description: Soon, you will gasp at the scenery along the Great Ocean Road. Golden beaches and epic cliffs will set the scene, and wallabies inhabit the grasslands near the coast. On a private tour, you will travel most of the Great Ocean Road, which will include a hidden stop to search for koalas next to the coast. This will be a relaxed day of fishing villages and rolling waves with an overnight stop on the beach near Warrnambool. Although kangaroo sightings are rare along this route, you will still enjoy some spectacular birdlife throughout the day.

dayInfo.title: Grampians National Park – Eastern Grey Kangaroos
dayInfo.description: After feasting your eyes on the 12 Apostles, your private tour will lead you inland to the Grampians, which is a haven for eastern grey kangaroos. Large males bask in the sun, and youngsters hop amid the trees. Your guide will know of some stunning viewpoints, and here, you can sit and watch the marsupials. Furthermore, you will quickly learn kangaroo behavior. If you stay silent and move slowly, you can usually get very close. A few signs will indicate that it is time to stop and not interrupt the kangaroos further.

dayInfo.title: Kangaroo Island – Surrounded by Marsupials
dayInfo.description: After driving back to Melbourne this morning, you will say goodbye to your tour guide and fly to Kangaroo Island. As its name suggests, this is an excellent destination for an Australian kangaroo safari. The island’s main wildlife highlight is actually the koalas though. While these tree-clinging wonders have mostly disappeared from the mainland, on this small island you can see them directly from your room’s veranda. You can expect koalas and kangaroos to be your main feature as you settle into a two-night stay in a national park.

dayInfo.title: Kangaroo Island – More Kangaroo Safaris
dayInfo.description: With a full day on Kangaroo Island, you can explore different species. Kangaroo Island kangaroos are a subspecies of western grey kangaroos, and their chocolate-colored appearance is entirely different from what you would see on the mainland. Today’s full-day safari will lead you to the island’s wildlife hotspots and will focus on endemic island species. Here, you can also have some very personal moments with koalas. A barbecue dinner with the chance to watch hopping kangaroos at sunset will also be included today.

dayInfo.title: Flinders Ranges – Giant Red Kangaroos
dayInfo.description: After leaving Kangaroo Island by boat, you will transfer to the Flinders Ranges, which is a mysterious outback location where Aboriginal guides reveal wildlife secrets. This is the home of giant red kangaroos, which are the largest and most spectacular of the country’s marsupials. Red kangaroos are not to be approached, but your guides will lead you to quiet lookout points, where you can admire the marsupials. A boxing confrontation between two of the males is perhaps Australia’s ultimate safari highlight and is sometimes witnessed from your outback lodge.

dayInfo.title: Flinders Ranges – Stars and Red Kangaroos
dayInfo.description: With another day in the Flinders Ranges, you will feel immersed in Aboriginal stories, red kangaroos, and a seemingly endless expanse of wild bush. Other than raw nature and a wildlife world, there is very little here besides the spectacular stars. Over a slow day of local folklore and Outback exploration, you will immerse yourself in the Aboriginal ways and coexist with red kangaroos. Just to be out here in such a remote place is a highlight in itself, which will be made even better by your luxury lodge.

dayInfo.title: Perth – West Coast Australia
dayInfo.description: After a relaxing morning, you will transfer to Adelaide for a flight to Perth. Your hotel will be in the north of the city and along the coast. Your accommodation will also be the closest one to the local kangaroo populations. Nothing will be planned for the day, and it will be relatively late by the time you arrive. Therefore, you can check out the beach, try one of the city’s excellent restaurants, and embrace a very different atmosphere on this side of the country.

dayInfo.title: Perth – City and Wildlife Experiences
dayInfo.description: Amazingly, kangaroos can be spotted in the cityscape. Just like in Melbourne, you will venture on a half-day wildlife tour to a small reserve on the edge of the city. Here, you will encounter kangaroos and walking trails. This experience may prove to be a complete escape from urban life. This morning’s experience will be complemented by a free afternoon and evening in Perth. There is a lot going on in this vibrant city, and it is a nice swap of your more remote Australian experiences for the city.

dayInfo.title: Margaret River – Western Grey Kangaroos
dayInfo.description: Today, the Margaret River will be your final destination. It is a small town that is dominated by surf, vineyards, and wildlife. You will check in to a small hotel on the coast and have time to try out local produce or to take a stroll along the beach. When the day’s heat fades, you will travel by 4WD into the wilderness on the trail of western grey kangaroos. You can enjoy a mug of steaming billy pot tea and a slice of home-baked orange cake along a river as the kangaroos hop past at sunset.

dayInfo.title: Margaret River – Vineyards, Marsupials, and Magical Moments
dayInfo.description: This final day will be left free and is completely customizable. After almost two weeks of Australian kangaroo safaris, you may be happy to leave the wildlife behind and focus on other pleasures, such as beaches and vineyards. You can also find many great self-guided walking trails and local reserves that are teeming with wallabies. The Margaret River is a slow and serene place to be, and it is perfect for the end of a vacation and for preparing yourself for the journey home. Today, you can sit back, relax, and reminisce on all the different kangaroo encounters.

dayInfo.title: Perth – Departure
dayInfo.description: From the Margaret River, you will transfer back to Perth, where you will start your journey home from the city’s airport.

tourName: Highlights of the Great Barrier Reef & Australia’s East Coast Tour
placesVisited: Sydney, Hamilton Island, Cairns, Daintree National Park, Port Douglas, Great Barrier Reef
generalInfo: The dreamlike landscape of Australia encompasses iridescent waters and emerald rainforest, an opera house of elegant sails and beaches with soft sand that crushes beneath your feet. Snorkel the Great Barrier Reef to discover schools of glowing butterfly fish, and then lounge on the famous Bondi Beach in view of surfers as they catch the curling waves. Indulge in a tranquil view of sandstone pillars that soar above the Jamison Valley and then bask in luxury at a resort that overlooks the shores of Hamilton Island. Your custom tailored tour will highlight the wonders of the East coast as you are immersed in the Aboriginal culture and the welcoming warmth of the Coral Sea.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – Arrive in the Bustling City of Sydney to an Introductory Tour
dayInfo.description: Sydney is a pearl of the Pacific Ocean, celebrated for illustrious beach culture and spectacular architecture that celebrates both land and sea. Your flight will land at Sydney Airport where your private transfer will meet you at baggage claim. Your hotel is located near the bustling downtown region that overlooks Darling Harbour, and will offer a perfect blend of city access with the relaxing ambiance of the seaside. You can look out your window to a view of sailboats floating past one another and graceful arch of the Harbour Bridge glinting in drifting sunlight. Your guide will greet you in your hotel lobby, keen on introducing you to the stunning highlights of the city, from the old walkways of the Rocks district, Sydney’s oldest neighborhood, to the marvelous arcades of the Queen Victoria Building. The shopping center was originally erected in the late 19th century beneath a set of 20 cupolas encircling the central dome, and the natural light spills into the main gallery highlighting the historical window frames and mosaic tile floors. Your guide will point to the allegorical marble figures above the entrances of York Street, representing the “Genius of the City,” with the two figures above the entrance of George Street embodying the glory of civilization.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – Explore Sydney Opera House and Beautiful Bondi Beach
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the cafes of the Glebe neighborhood open to local university students eager to order a rejuvenating cappuccino. A vintage and artisan market open up alongside the streets to showcase homemade honey and preserves set beside the flowing skirts decorated with swirling colors. After breakfast, your guide will meet you at the hotel and lead you on a short walk along the brick esplanade to the exterior of the Sydney Opera House. The structure remains an icon of the city and Greater Australia, known for the way the rooftop imitates the sails of passing ships, eternally cast to catch the gentle sea breeze. The harbor waters lap against the base of the esplanade. The doors to the opera house opened in late 1973 with a seating capacity of nearly 2,700 patrons in the main concert hall. The lavish interior reminds you of a clam, embellished with vaulted ceilings and a textured background behind the main stage. The fabulous acoustics enable a person’s voice to echo against the walls in all direction. Your day will continue outside of the opera house, taking you from the grandeur of concert culture to the relaxed pace of the beachside culture at Bondi, known for pristine sand, gentle waves, and the reality television show of “Bondi Rescue.” The seaside swimming pool of the Icebergs Private Swimming Club overlooks the water splashing against the rocks.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – Relish Sydney’s Splendor and Surroundings at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: Decorating one of the Sydney estuaries of Homebush Bay is the SS Ayrfield. The neighborhood’s past as a trading port informs its present, accentuated by the rusting walls of the abandoned freighter decorating the waters. The ship was once used to transport coal and war supplies but has since sprouted lush mangrove trees with branches peeking through the hull of the ship first erected in 1911. The remarkable ship resembles a toy boat used as a flowerpot, made more remarkable due to the grand size of the ship, along with its ability to continue floating. Sydney and its surroundings have marvels often overlooked by visitors, so this day will bring you the opportunity to go in search of the city’s hidden wonders and the splendors of the surrounding countryside. For a full day exploration, you will take a private tour of Blue Mountains National Park, an area of New South Wales that fills more than 4,400 square miles. The eucalyptus trees cast an ethereal blue vapor in the early morning light giving credence to the name. You will arrive at the weathered sandstone peaks along the cliffs of Jamison Valley where the Three Sisters stand nearly 3,000 feet above the valley floor. In the foreground, you can see the striking layers of color cast by the sandstone, with a background of the emerald canopy and rocky plateaus.

dayInfo.title: Hamilton Island – Fly to the Lovely Shores and Luxuries of Hamilton Island
dayInfo.description: Each morning, the Sydney Fish Market opens its doors along Blackwattle Bay. The interior of the market is filled with seafood caught fresh that morning and sold by the very fishers who caught it. Seagulls hover above the wrought-iron structure before diving down to the shore in search of mud crabs. Restaurants bordering the edges of the market serve fresh lobster and lean salmon. After breakfast and a short wander of the market, your private transfer will meet you at your hotel and escort you to Sydney Airport for your flight to the tropical paradise of Hamilton Island. The picturesque landscape overlooks the indigo waters of the Coral Sea, a subsidiary of the Pacific Ocean. The island encompasses nearly two square miles with narrow streets utilized by golf carts, creating a resort ambiance embellished by palm trees, rainforest, and shading ferns. Travel to your remarkable hotel by way of a private transfer, settling into the comforts of the lapping waves and coconut aromas set against the luxurious accommodations that overlook the white sand beach. Dip your toes into the hot powdery sand and enjoy the marvelous views of the rolling hills of the nearby Whitsunday Islands.

dayInfo.title: Hamilton Island – Enjoy a Day on Hamilton Island at your Preferred Pace
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the scent of the Coral Sea blends with sweet aromas of coconut and mango emanating from the open-air dining room. Monitor lizards roam in the forest underbrush and sunbathe on rocks. After a leisurely breakfast, the day is yours to indulge in the charms of Hamilton Island as you desire. Board a sailboat bound for the sandy beaches of Whitehaven Island or enjoy a jet skiing safari around the shores of Hamilton. For a fantastic introduction to the wildlife of Australia, you can make your way to the hands-on animal experiences found at Wild Life Hamilton Island. The dense trees add to the ambiance of the wildlife park as koalas dangle from the eucalyptus branches and macaws perch in the canopy to watch all who pass by. Your guide will lead you on a tour of the grounds, engaging you with each unique species you pass, from bouncing kangaroos to lounging crocodiles. At the end of your guided excursion, you will be introduced to a sleepy koala latching to a low-lying tree. Your guide will slowly pass you the koala, and you can gently cuddle the furry marsupial, enjoying the unique chance to hold a domesticated wild animal iconic to Australia.

dayInfo.title: Port Douglas – Transfer from Hamilton Island to the Charm of Port Douglas
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the luscious aroma of coconut blends with the rejuvenating rich aromatics of freshly brewed coffee. Godwits call out to one another in the trees as kangaroos bounce in the open plains and monitor lizards search for breakfast amidst the underbrush. After your own breakfast, your private transfer will escort you to the airport for your flight north to Cairns. The city has an esplanade that winds along the coast, adorned with volleyball courts and swimming lagoons, vibrant cafes and chic bars. Your private transfer will greet you upon your flight’s arrival and lead you north to the seaside town of Port Douglas as cafes and boutique shops line the elegant streets that lead to the marina. Sailboat masts wade in the water and sway from side to side. You will notice how the rainforest that blankets the Great Dividing Range sweeps down the slopes and nearly touches the indigo waters of the Pacific. White sand stretches along the shore of Four Mile Beach shaded by towering palm trees. You will settle into the comforts of your luxurious hotel set between the lush trees of the rainforest while offering views to the shimmering ocean. The town bustles around the main street of Macrossan, where the delicate aromas of grilling seafood drifts out of the traditional restaurants of Far North Queensland.

dayInfo.title: Port Douglas – Full Day Tour Exploring the Wonder of the Great Barrier Reef
dayInfo.description: At dawn, the sunlight stretches along the eastern horizon layering the sky with dramatic reds, oranges, and pinks. You will rise early in the morning to board the catamaran bound for the Great Barrier Reef. Your boat will weigh anchor, and your excitement will make your heart pound. The Great Barrier Reef is one of the natural wonders of the world, encompassing a collection of coral bodies that span nearly 133,000 square miles. The sea air will brush against your cheeks as the boat brings mist that rises from the ocean surface. You can see the darker segments of water scattered across the ocean where reefs have formed, and you will jump into the water at Opal Reef after donning your snorkel gear. The gentle waves are welcoming, and the warm temperature will immediately relax you. You will look beneath the surface to find the crescent shape of the reef edging the continental shelf as staghorn coral forests, and giant clams glow within the bright light beams that pierce up to 200 feet below the surface. Stingrays swim past effortlessly as their wings flutter like butterflies and can grow to a length of up to 23 feet in length. The spectacular underwater world of the coral reef system is unparalleled to the wonders you have seen across Australia thus far.

dayInfo.title: Cairns – Traverse the Trails and Rugged Beauty of Daintree National Park
dayInfo.description: Wake early and then venture beneath the canopy of Daintree National Park to hear the tails of the Rainbow Serpent and the beginning of the world during Dreamtime. You will travel into Mossman Gorge to immerse yourself in the traditions of the local Aboriginal tribe of the Kuku Yalanji. The thick forest canopy shades you from the sunlight with emerald leaves that spread across the sky. Your guide will point out the plants used to make soap, utilizing both the soil and the underbrush to make ochre paint for art. The trail leads you through the thick trunks of the forest as you listen to stories of life’s beginnings around the Australian bush. Songs layer the walk by revealing traditions, telling stories of spirits and ancestors found amongst nature. You can hear the stream moving over the rocks in the distance. Freshwater fish leap out of the creak in search of passing insects. After your immersive tour on the trail you continue to the rainforest town of Kuranda, where heritage markets and stalls showcasing artisan crafts line the streets, accented with the aroma of fresh fallen rain and grilling meat.

dayInfo.title: Cairns – Delight in a Day in Cairns to Adventure at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will wake up to the aromas of papaya and banana blending with the rich aromatics of freshly roasted coffee beans. The waves lap at the golden shores of Four Mile Beach as the breeze rustles against the palm trees that shade the beachgoers. After breakfast, the day is yours to enjoy the coastline and the rainforest expanse, as you desire. Lounge by the pool of your resort-style accommodation or embark on a unique excursion to the Atherton Tablelands. If you are willing to rise early, you could travel beyond the mountain range to reach the open plains that are blanketed with hot air balloons. Your guide will inflate your balloon, filling predawn sky with light. You will step into your gondola, and the hot air balloon will slowly ascend. You can see the light spreading along the horizon as the colors blend into one another and layer together in the distance, taking away the starlight above. Once the sun peeks above the ocean, you will have an unparalleled view of the rainforest below, and the sparkling banks of the river that wind towards the East Coast.

dayInfo.title: Cairns – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: The morning light shines through the windows of the Port Douglas art galleries, exhibiting the unique perspectives of local artists and the way they perceive the surrounding culture and scenery. The work of Cara Stevens uses the landscape in photography and it three-dimensional sculptures, capturing the natural colors and formations of the Queensland region in ways often overlooked by the untrained eye. You have witnessed the beauty beyond the coastline and the sensational splendors beneath the forest canopy during your exploration of Australia, from the architectural thrills of the Sydney Opera House to the beauty that decorates the Great Barrier Reef. After one last morning of enjoying your surroundings along with a leisurely breakfast, your private transfer will meet you at your hotel in Port Douglas and escort you to Cairns Airport for your flight home.

tourName: Incredible Australian Family Vacation
placesVisited: Sydney, Hobart, Kingscote, Adelaide, Port Lincoln, Baird Bay, Lake Gairdner
generalInfo: From Far North Queensland to New South Wales and from the sands of the Outback to the crystalline waters of the Great Barrier Reef, your 16-day family Australia tour will immerse you in the marvelous adventures of land and sea. Indulge in intimate encounters with Australia’s unique wildlife, partake in a luxury camping experience, explore the Great Barrier Reef, and learn to surf at Bondi Beach. Whether you spend a day at a wildlife sanctuary or bask in an evening under the stars, you will experience much of the best of Australian during this 16-day vacation.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – Arrive in the Spectacular City of Sydney
dayInfo.description: You will land in Sydney, which is home to one of the world’s most iconic skylines. From the graceful arch of the Harbour Bridge to the unforgettable sails of the Opera House, the city will feel familiar as your family travels with a private driver from the airport to your luxurious accommodation in the heart of the bustling Central Business District. A multicultural metropolis unlike any other on the planet, Sydney is filled with delicious restaurants, fascinating museums, superb shopping areas, and breathtaking scenery. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to settle in to the comforts of your suite and the pace of Australia’s famous coastal setting. You can stroll through Hyde Park or engage in some retail therapy at the shops in the gorgeous Queen Victoria Building. The arcade was built in the 19th century and retains a sense of grandeur, which is embodied in the 20 small domes that frame the central dome. The original mosaic floors highlight the beauty of the architecture and the luxury goods of the-more-than-200 boutique shops inside the center.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – Explore the Unique and Unforgettable City on a Tour
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the sea breeze will carry the aroma of saltwater through the streets of the Central Business District. After breakfast, your guide will meet you in the hotel lobby to take you on a private tour through the diverse city neighborhoods. To begin, you will explore the city by bicycle, riding from the gorgeous greenery at the Royal Botanic Gardens to the stunning sights along the Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. The comfortable ride will provide you with an incredible sense of life in this cosmopolitan metropolis. Your family will cycle along the piers at Walsh Bay and the monuments of Hyde Park as your friendly and knowledgeable guide offers you insight on local customs, history, and tradition. At the Rocks, you will find the Oldest neighborhood in Sydney’s and the oldest remaining residential home in Australia. Cadman’s Cottage was built in 1816 and hides among the 100 heritage buildings that are scattered along the narrow streets and alleyways beneath the Harbour Bridge.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – Learn to Surf at Bondi Beach and Enjoy a Day at Leisure
dayInfo.description: The surfing scene in Australia is one of the best in the world and is complete with some of the largest waves and the best riders. Nowhere else is this proud tradition on display with such fervor than at the world-renowned Bondi Beach. You will have a private transfer to the illustrious golden shores of the famous shoreline, where you will have the chance to fully experience the incredible environment as you spend an hour with a private instructor, learning how to surf like a true Aussie. Surfing rookies and experienced wave riders alike will delight in the one-on-one attention, and the attentive and qualified staff will be sure to answer all of your questions. As you listen to the waves crash near the shoreline, your guide will get you up on your feet faster than you could have ever thought possible. The warm water will invite you into the bay, and the consistent breaks will help you find an excellent rhythm. Following your lesson, you might want to grab lunch at one of the excellent restaurants that line the sand at Bondi Beach.

dayInfo.title: Hobart – Venture to Tasmania for a Relaxing Day in Hobart
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will have a private transfer to the airport in Sydney for your flight to Tasmania, which is Australia’s only island state and home to some of the most beautiful and diverse scenery on the planet. Nearly half of Tasmania is designated as national parkland, allowing for wildlife of all types to flourish and thrive. You will be led to the state capital of Hobart and to the door of your gorgeous accommodations, which will be an award-winning hotel that was converted from a 1930s pier building to become one of the premier places to stay in all of Tasmania. The sleek and modern amenities will give you a sense of comfort and serenity, while the views of the River Derwent and Sullivan’s Cover will captivate and inspire you. The hotel’s ideal location will offer a myriad of opportunities to get out and explore the surrounding area. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to discover the sandstone edifices at Battery Point, the chic cafes, and the restaurants in Hobart’s Central Business District.

dayInfo.title: Hobart – Be Keeper for a Day at Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary
dayInfo.description: Australia is home to some of the most diverse wildlife in the world, and, today, you will have the opportunity to get up-close and personal with some of its most famous residents at the unparalleled Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary. After breakfast, your guide will meet you at the hotel and lead you to Bonorong, which has more than 30 years of experience in native animal rehabilitation and education. The sanctuary has been at the forefront of conservation efforts in Tasmania and will allow your family to become Keepers for a Day. During this experience, you will learn all about the animals that they care for and the work that goes into making sure that these magnificent animals are around for future generations. You can spend some time with the iconic Tasmanian Devils of Bonorong, where you will learn their names, personalities, the challenges they face, and what you can do to help. Face-to-face photo opportunities will be abounding, and the bravest among you can even feed these unforgettable creatures. From the amazing animals to the personable and dedicated staff that work at the Sanctuary, this singular experience will be sure to be one that you never forget.

dayInfo.title: Hobart – Cruise the Coastline and a Visit Port Arthur
dayInfo.description: Your guide will meet you at your hotel in the morning to lead your family on a full-day exploration of the Tasman Peninsula. You will travel along the island’s rugged coastline and past some of the most memorable sights for visions of the breathtaking landscapes, from Eaglehawk Neck to Port Arthur. You can stop to see the Tasman Blowhole, which is a geological formation that spouts water into the air up to 32 feet. You will then pass sea caves and the tallest sea cliffs in Australia, which soar above the water at 984 feet tall. Following a delicious lunch, you will embark on a guided expedition of the Port Arthur Historic Site, which is a legacy of the penal foundations of Australia and the best-known site of the convict era. Impressive structures still dominate the site for more than one hundred years after their construction, from the imposing cell blocks of the penitentiary to the reconstructed rooms of the Commandant’s Residence. This will prove to be an especially engaging introduction to the culture and history of the town.

dayInfo.title: Kingscote – Travel to South Australia with the Day at your Pace
dayInfo.description: Today, your family will leave the natural splendor of Tasmania to venture to the marvels of Kangaroo Island, which is the nation’s third-largest island and one of the best places to spot Australian wildlife in its natural habitat. While on Kangaroo Island, you will stay at a splendid hotel that stands on the seashore with large and comfortable rooms that offer immaculate views of crashing waves and the sweeping shoreline. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to bask in the charms of your accommodation or to sample the delicious seafood across the island. Local restaurants catch delicious ingredients fresh from the water each day. You can gaze at the display of life that populates Kangaroo Island as well as the odd and fascinating geological formations that dot the area. The aptly-named Remarkable Rock demonstrates the unique contours of the landscape with naturally sculpted boulders that are reminiscent of sculptures by the artist Henry Moore. The wooden boardwalk winds around the terrain and is shaped by the wind, rain, and pounding waves.

dayInfo.title: Kingscote – Discover Wilderness and Wildlife at Kangaroo Island
dayInfo.description: A coast-to-coast journey throughout Kangaroo Island will be on your itinerary for today, and you can give your family unsurpassed views of the incomparable island from the sea and sky. You will also have the opportunity to mingle with the friendly locals that call Kangaroo Island home. Your guide will meet you after breakfast and lead you to a celebrated honey farm. During your time on the farm, your guide will introduce you to the methods for making honey and allow your family to become beekeepers under the guidance of a professional. After your bee experience, you will continue to the sands of Vivonne Bay, where you can stroll along the beach that was once hailed by an expert as one of the best in all of Australia. The afternoon will lead you to the renowned shores of Seal Bay, where you will have the unique pleasure of a guided patrol in the midst of a colony of Australian sea lions. The endangered species that are endemic to this part of the world can grow over eight feet long and weigh more than 661 pounds. Their darling faces and delightful mannerisms will enchant everyone in your family, and will not want to miss your chance for an intimate introduction to the Australian sea lions.

dayInfo.title: Adelaide – Visit a Eucalyptus Distillery and Ferry to the Mainland
dayInfo.description: Today, you will continue your discovery of Kangaroo Island by uncovering the natural beauty and abundant wildlife that can be found nowhere else on Earth. You will start at the Emu Ridge Eucalyptus Distillery, which is the only commercial Eucalyptus Oil Distillery in South Australia. Here, you will find eucalyptus products and a variety of crafts in their gallery before reaching the Parndana Wildlife Park to feed local kangaroos from the palm of your hand. Their fuzzy noses will brush against your skin before you continue for glimpses of lazy koalas at the Hanson Bay Wildlife Sanctuary. Later in the afternoon, you will take the ferry to Gulf St. Vincent to reach the mainland before transferring to Adelaide, which is the capital of South Australia and one of the most livable cities in the country. The elegant city plan will captivate your family by highlighting the surrounding parks and many detailed edifices that line the main streets, from the orderly row of terraced houses to the climbing tower of St. Francis Xavier’s Cathedral. Your accommodations will represent a modern marvel in a restored and rejuvenated government building.

dayInfo.title: Port Lincoln – Delight in the Unforgettable Outback
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will head out to the heart of Australia’s bush country to embark on a family-friendly camping trip of a lifetime that will include all of the marvels of the unrivaled wilderness while keeping your familiar comfortable. You will arrive at Port Lincoln and meet your tour guide, who will lead you on an unforgettable journey, beginning at a wild koala colony at Mikkira Station. Then, you will pass the charming village of Wudinna and the formidable shape of Mt. Wudinna, which is Australia’s second-largest monolith, before turning to the pre-constructed camp at Kangaluna. The afternoon will be dedicated to exploring the flora and fauna of the area, including three separate species of kangaroos and flocks of emus. In the evening, your family can enjoy the sunset at the base of the phenomenal Kolay Mirica Falls. The basalt columns of the volcanic rock formations along the cliffs resemble tubes and are known as the Organ Pipes.

dayInfo.title: Lake Gairdner – Find the Wonders of Landscape and Wildlife
dayInfo.description: Today, your family will set out early from camp to traverse the rugged landscapes of South Australia and the far reaches of Lake Gairdner National Park. Afterward, you will visit an ochre pit where the natural coloring agent comes rich and ready from below the surface of the earth before reaching the shores of Lake Gairdner. The salt flats that surround the body of water are home to a number of land speed record attempts and are the current location for the yearly “Speed Week.” The vibrant colors and sumptuous hues of the sun will shine across this arid plain and dazzle your eyes with the wide array of plant life and an abundance of birds. The afternoon will feature a ride through the landscape of contrast and inconstancy. The colors will change with the setting sun to create a spectacle that is nearly divine. You can keep an eye out for kangaroos and emus on your way back to camp, which is where you will enjoy another splendid evening under a starlit sky.

dayInfo.title: Baird Bay – Dive with Dolphins and Swim with Sea Lions
dayInfo.description: This morning, your guide will meet you at camp to escort you to the brilliant blue water of South Australia’s coast for an experience that will never be recreated or forgotten. Eventually, you will board a boat and travel along the water to marvel at the bottlenose dolphins that play in your wake, breaking the surface in playful leaps and seemingly savoring your company. Upon reaching a lagoon at Jones Island, you will be able to mingle with the dolphins in the shallow waters to enjoy their frisky behavior and endearing affectations. Then, you will cross the bay for a rare treat and encounter a colony of Australian sea lions that are as friendly as they are adorable. Your kids may even get a very wet kiss planted on their faces. Following lunch, you will cruise past indescribable coastal panoramas and the charming towns of Venus Bay and Elliston before returning to Port Lincoln.

dayInfo.title: Cairns – Gateway to the Great Barrier Reef
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your transfer will lead you along the weathered splendor of South Australia to reach the airport. Today, you will be bound for the exotic locales of Queensland it the city of Cairns. Cairns acts as the jumping-off point for the inimitable grandeur of the Great Barrier Reef. Hemmed by lush rainforests and the azure stretch of the Coral Sea, Cairns is steeped in natural wonder and filled with cosmopolitan delights. You will have the day at your leisure with accommodations on the shorefront and located within the breathtaking heart of the city. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to enjoy the beauty of Cairns from the comforts of your hotel, which is within easy walking distance of some of the city’s best attractions.

dayInfo.title: Cairns – Explore the Incomparable Great Barrier Reef
dayInfo.description: The pinnacle of Northern Australia and arguably the Southern Hemisphere, Australia’s Great Barrier Reef is the largest structure made by living organisms on the planet. The reef is A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the Seven Wonders of the Natural World. Today, you will journey to the very edge of this magnificent system in Agincourt Reef to find the inviting water temperature of the water and unique topography of the seafloor. The location of this remarkable ribbon reef creates an ecosystem that is recognized by experts to be the most pristine throughout the entire region and features clear water for visibility of coral growth and marine life of up to 100 feet. Your family can get close enough to touch the technicolor hues of the coral by diving, snorkeling, or by climbing aboard a semi-sub that descends below the water’s surface. You will discover the marvels of the Great Barrier Reef by visiting only a portion of the living ecosystem, which spans more than 134,600 square miles and features marine life like blue tang, manta rays, and clownfish.

dayInfo.title: Cairns – Save Sea Turtles at a Local Rehab Center
dayInfo.description: Your final full day in Australia will be spent doing some good with the caring volunteers at the wonderful Cairns Turtle Rehabilitation Centre. This privately-funded organization is committed to helping save the six species of turtles from the waters around the Great Barrier Reef and the Cape York Peninsula. Your transfer will escort you to the center, where you will encounter dedicated scientists and marine biologists who study these gorgeous animals and help prepare them for life in the wild after they have been maimed or struck with a catastrophic illness known as “floater’s syndrome.” The results of this remarkable center are spectacular because the rehabilitation rate for the turtles they care for has climbed to nearly 85%. Your guide will introduce you to the different species of turtles by offering stories of each turtle they help, including their species like the flatback turtle that can grow three feet in length and weigh up to 200 pounds. Not only will you have the rare opportunity to get close to these delicate and sensitive animals, but you will also feel the singular warmth of helping them return to their natural homes.

dayInfo.title: Cairns – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: You will leave early in the morning to the airport at Cairns, where you will be transported to Brisbane or Sydney for your flight back home. The flight will give you plenty of time to reflect on what you have seen, heard, learned, and experienced. From the bright lights of Sydney to the explosion of color in the Great Barrier Reef, this is one trip that you will remember for the rest of your life.

tourName: Independent New Zealand Tour: North Island
placesVisited: Auckland, Waiheke Island, Rotorua, Napier, Wellington
generalInfo: Discover the spirit of adventure on an independent journey through the North Island of New Zealand. Islands sprawl along the horizon off the coast of Auckland. The sounds of Maori cries echo in the night sky. The Southern Cross sparkles along the shiny Milky Way. Mountains undulate and you watch the Southern Hemisphere unfold. The spirit of the independent traveler is encouraged and rewarded on this New Zealand trip . From the friendly locals to the stunning landscape, experience the journey and enjoy the adventure of independence.

dayInfo.title: Auckland - Independence Day (One)
dayInfo.description: Land in Auckland ready to explore and enjoy New Zealand’s most populated city. Sky Tower, the tallest freestanding structure in the Southern Hemisphere, tops the city skyline, the spiraled point sticking into the clear sky. Wander through lively Queens Street on your way to the harbors where the heart of the city can be seen pulsing. The salty smell of the ocean comes on the back of the breeze that blows through the streets. The sails from boats lining the harbor jut into the air giving the city its nickname, “City of Sails.” Visit the Auckland museum located in one of New Zealand's most historical buildings situated in a central city pleasure garden. The scent of roses lingers beneath your nose from spring to autumn and the crisp cool breeze blows in the winter. The exhibitions are exciting, full of artistic integrity and Pacific culture. Monumental carvings decorate certain exhibits, shaved from local trees, polished and shiny in their frozen faced adaptation of traditional spirits. Canoes and replicated communal buildings remain unobstructed and unimpeded for everyone to understand the cultures that have made up the current face of New Zealand. The Auckland War Memorial Museum is another of the museum’s efforts to commemorate the country’s past. An empty tomb on a pedestal stands without decoration or religious symbols to help honor those that fought for the Common Wealth during World War I. The contrast of commemorating the native soldiers lost in battle with commemorating the native culture is among the important understandings of a country coming to terms with its past and is part of the beauty that New Zealand offers as a reward to those willing to find it.

dayInfo.title: Auckland - Cultural Tastes
dayInfo.description: Spend the day away from the city by traveling to the stunning beauty and flavors of Waiheke Island. The island is chockfull of beaches, vineyards, olive groves, and lovely villages. Venture from Auckland harbor and take the ferry to Waiheke. The water is an opal blue. The boats in the harbor rock back and forth as the sails sway in the wake before shrinking in the distance. Reaching the island brings the stunning faded sand and pearl blue water of the beach. The lush hills roll into the distance. For lunch you will taste the delicacy of Stoneyridge winery. The hills are almost indistinguishable from the vines as they wrap around and over the horizon. The salty sea air is still drifting from the water and mixes with the fresh soil of the vineyard. Mentioned in the February 2003 issue of UK Wine Magazine under “Cult Wines of the World,” Stoneyridge wines have a rich and varied flavor due to the miscellaneous terrain. Larose wine is a mixture of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec, and Petit Verdot. A Bordeaux-style red wine with dark, wild berry fruits and freshly ground cinnamon on the nose and a firm, medium finish underlying a palate of sweet fruit.
